Description: Fragment of floor of Milesian pottery plate; fired red-brown. Large rosette in field with standing triangles and other filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Compare Louvre AM1363(13), possibly from same plate, though very differently fired.

Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p.10, pl. 2,18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1038)
